name: Gem
tagline: An Elastic, Local Similarity Measure with Automatic Trend Adjustment
body:
### Welcome to the supplementary webpage for the GEM paper

This page is intended to give additional information and material including all data sets and source code. You can download all supplementary material in a single zip file (see left) or browse the repository at [github.](https://github.com/gempaper/gem)

### cDTW vs. GEM dendrograms and the Metal dataset

This sections provides additional dendrograms obtained on the left split (indices 100-499) of the [metal dataset.](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/tree/master/data/metal) We only state three examples of different types for brevity. All misclassifications of cDTW on this split can be found [here](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/tree/master/results/dendrograms) in pdf or png format. For a given index the upper dendrogram shows the complete linkage clustering for constrained DTW (with learned parameters) and the lower one the same for the GEM similarity measure (with learned parameters). The images are rendered with [DendrogramMetal.py](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/DendrogramMetall.py) -- feel free to edit this file to obtain dendrograms with single or average linkage.

##### Index 171 (local trends/deformation)

Obviously, the corresponding child (C) and parent (P) metal strips share a lot of features but differ in a wandering baseline. This artifact is caused by deformation of the fabricated material. The best match (L) under the cDTW distance measure (with learned parameters) accidentally has the same local mean. However, GEM's invariance under local trends makes it possible to select the correct correspondence.

![171](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/results/dendrograms/dendrogram_cdtw_vs_gem_171.png?raw=true)

##### Index 194 (extraction failure/unknown scale)

Although all time series have been scaled to the same length to synchronize the sampling rate of both sensors it may happen, that the extraction of the signal from the data stream is imprecise. A close look at the dendrogram reveals that a slightly downscaled version of P fits a substantial region of C. GEM features scale and translation invariant subsequence matching in the time domain which enables us to find the correct mapping.

![194](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/results/dendrograms/dendrogram_cdtw_vs_gem_194.png?raw=true)

##### Index 255 (occlusion/sensor failure)

This example demonstrates how z-normalization can be harmful when sensor failure occurs. The amplitudes of the distorted time series (P) are significantly altered. GEM avoids this artifact since it does not use z-normalization and allows skips in the query or subject sequence.

![255](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/results/dendrograms/dendrogram_cdtw_vs_gem_255.png?raw=true)

### Metal and Fish resampled 1NN
Detailed information about all tested distance measures (GEM, (c)DTW, ED) the used splits and learned parameters can be found in the [result folder] (https://github.com/gempaper/gem/tree/master/results/finalresults) (dn_M* and dn_39*). The histograms can be generated with [ResultsMetall.py](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/ResultsMetall.py) and [ResultsFish.py](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/ResultsFish.py).

##### Metal relative error rates
![metallhist](https://raw.github.com/gempaper/gem/master/results/metall/Metalvs.png)

##### Fish relative error rates
![fishhist](https://raw.github.com/gempaper/gem/master/results/fish/Fishvs.png)

### UCR database resampled 1NN

The detailed classification rates for all  tested distance measures (GEM, (c)DTW, ED) can be found [here](https://raw.github.com/gempaper/gem/master/results/ucrdistances/results). This table can be generated with the given [Python script](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/ResultsUCR.py). For even more details like the individual splits each iteration  please have a look at the [results folder.](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/tree/master/results/finalresults)

##### Visualized classification error
The averaged error rates and standard deviations (error bars) for constrained DTW and GEM on the individual datasets of the UCR repository are shown below. 

![ucrresults ](https://raw.github.com/gempaper/gem/master/results/ucrdistances/UCRResults.png)

##### Prediction power (Texas sharpshooter plot)
The averaged differences of relative error rates and standard deviations (error bars) for constrained DTW and GEM (for both training and test set) on the individual datasets of the UCR repository are shown below.

![sharpshooter](https://raw.github.com/gempaper/gem/master/results/ucrdistances/UCRSharpShooter.png)

### Speedup Measurements
The makefile for the UCR Suite including the used compiler flags can be found [here.](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/ucrsuite/Makefile) The queries and subject of the ECG dataset are provided at the [supplementary website of the UCR Suite.](http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~eamonn/UCRsuite.html) The queries and subject for the metal dataset can be generated with the given [Python script.](https://github.com/gempaper/gem/blob/master/QueryAndSubjectGeneratorMetall.py)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
